newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: UNHCR has no confirmation of Zaire killings.
newsitem.headline: UNHCR has no confirmation of Zaire killings.

text.p: The United Nations refugee agency UNHCR said on Thursday it had no confirmation of eyewitness accounts of mass killings in eastern Zaire, as reported by Belgium.

Belgian Development and Cooperation Minister Reginald Moreels told Het Laatste Nieuws newspaper at the weekend he had received eyewitness reports that a new "genocide" was under way in East Zaire and that mass graves had been found.
UNHCR spokesman Fernando del Mundo said his agency had no independent confirmation of the reported killings in the region, where movements of U.N. staff have been restricted by the war.

Del Mundo said a Zairean agency, Equilibre, reported it found 6,800 bodies of Rwandan Hutus and Zaireans during a six to eight week period after the fall of the border town of Goma late last year to Tutsi-led rebels, but UNHCR could not confirm this.
"We have no information about these killings. Our people in Goma haven't found large-scale massacres. It would be difficult to hide huge massacres of thousands of people," he said.
A Belgian Foreign Ministry spokesman said on Wednesday that Belgium's ambassadors in the region were checking the reports.
In Paris, Foreign Ministry spokesman Jacques Rummelhardt said: "We've heard of these reports. They seem to be credible.

"If the facts reported in the localities mentioned really happened, it would be necessary to find out if these acts, which can only prompt indignation and condemnation, happened across Zaire as a whole and were committed deliberately."

The conflict between rebels and Zairean troops escalated this month with the bombing of rebel-held towns. It has sent tens of thousands of refugees fleeing and threatens to destabilise vast Zaire and its central African neighbours.
